TextJPN: 『本日は貸切です。～雀荘「鈴」～』
TextENG: 'Reserved for the day. ~Suzu Mahjong Parlor~'

TextJPN: カランカラ～ン。
TextENG: Clatter-clack.

TextJPN: 「あんりゃ、蔵ちゃん。あんたが一番遅いよ～？　若い人はみんな揃ってる」
TextENG: ``Heya, Kura-chan. You're the last one here~ All the youngsters are here already.``

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは…。じゃあお母さん、すみませんね」
TextENG: ``Na-ha-ha-ha... Excuse me, miss.``

TextJPN: 大石が、タバコが１カートン入ったコンビニの袋を渡すと、雀荘の主である婆さんは要領よく姿を消した。@k…もう慣れっこなのだ。
TextENG: Ooishi handed over a convenience store bag with a carton of cigarettes in it to the old lady who owned the mahjong parlor, and she shrewdly made herself scarce.@k ...She was used to this by now.

TextJPN: 「大石さん！　お疲れさまっす！！」
TextENG: ``Ooishi-san! Good work today!!``

TextJPN: 「なんだ、みんな真面目に待ってたんですか？　サンマでもやってりゃ良かったのに」
TextENG: ``What, were you all earnestly waiting for me? You could've just done three-player.``

TextJPN: 狭い店内に並べられた雀卓には皆、大石の部下たちが座っているが、どの卓にも麻雀牌は出ていない。
TextENG: Everyone sitting at the mahjong tables in the small parlor were Ooishi's subordinates, but there were no tiles laid out anywhere.

TextJPN: 「皆さん、連日の不眠不休の捜査、本当にお疲れさまです」
TextENG: ``Everyone, I'd like to thank you for your days of investigation without sleep.``

TextJPN: 「「ぅおおっす！！」」
威勢のいい返事が雀荘を満たす。@k…そこはすでに娯楽場の雰囲気ではない。
TextENG: Energetic responses filled the parlor.@k ...Already, it had lost the atmosphere of a place of entertainment.

TextJPN: 「状況は芳しくありません。署長が園崎系議員の恫喝に屈したそうです」
TextENG: ``The situation is not looking good. The chief appears to have backed down due to Congressman Sonozaki's threats.

TextJPN: 「近日中に鷹野殺しはお隣の県警さんに譲り、村長たちの失踪は行方不明扱いで生活課に委ねるようです」
TextENG: In the coming days, we'll hand off Takano's murder to the neighbouring prefecture, and give the missing persons case of the disappearance of the mayor and the others to the community division.``

TextJPN: …あの若造署長が。@kベテランたちが吐き捨てる。
TextENG: ...That damn upstart chief.@k The veterans in the room cursed him.

TextJPN: 「請求した令状も全て却下されました。課長からは園崎家界隈には近付くなとまで言われています。@k@vS20/11/440700185.…いやいや、困ったモンです」
TextENG: ``All of our requests for warrants were turned down as well. I've even been told by our section chief not to go anywhere near the Sonozaki house.@k@vS20/11/440700185. ...We're certainly in a bind, that we are.

TextJPN: 「ちなみに、私には来週から警視庁への研修命令が出るそうです。その後は余った有休を伊豆で消化しろとまで言われています。@k@vS20/11/440700187.…いやぁ、そういうのも悪くないですねぇ～」
TextENG: Incidentally, it looks like I'll be getting orders soon to go to training at the Metropolitan Police Department starting next week. After that I've even been told to take a paid vacation in Izu.@k@vS20/11/440700187. ...Well, I suppose that ain't bad~``

TextJPN: 苦笑が漏れる。@k…笑い事ではないが、笑うしかなかった。
TextENG: He heard a few dry laughs.@k ...It wasn't anything to laugh about, but that was all they could do.

TextJPN: 「いつもそうですが、事件と車のキーの閉じ込めはよく似ています。開けるためのカギはいつもその中に閉じ込められているんです。@k@vS20/11/440700189.車なら修理業者を呼んで扉をこじ開ける。@k@vS20/11/440700190.事件なら？@k@vS20/11/440700191.　熊ちゃん、図面を」
TextENG: ``This always happens, but incidents are a lot like locking your keys in the car. The keys you need to unlock the door are always locked inside.@k@vS20/11/440700189. For cars, you call the repairman and they'll pry open your door.@k@vS20/11/440700190. For incidents?@k@vS20/11/440700191. Kuma-chan, show the map.``

TextJPN: 熊谷がホワイトボードをひっくり返す。@k裏には磁石で邸内の図面が貼られていた。
TextENG: Kumagai flipped over the whiteboard.@k On the back was a map of the Sonozaki premises made with magnets.

TextJPN: 「私もずーーっとこの商売をやってます。勘には自信があるつもりですがね、今回ばかりはハズレるかもしれませんよ？@k@vS20/11/440700193.　退職金が惜しい方は私が１０数える間に席を外してください」
TextENG: ``Now, I've been doing this job for a looong time. I've got a lot of faith in my gut, but this could be the one time it was wrong, no?@k@vS20/11/440700193. Anyone worried about their retirement money has until the count of ten to get out of here.``

TextJPN: 大石が１０を数え始めると、皆も同じように数え始める。
TextENG: Ooishi began to count to ten, and everyone counted along with him.

TextJPN: ……大石たちの名物、覚悟の１０カウントだ。
TextENG: ......It was their famous ten-count resolution.

TextJPN: 「９、１０！！　あ～あ～、誰も出てかないよ。@k@vS20/11/440700195.皆さん、ご家族はもっと大切にして下さいよ？　んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``Nine, ten!! Ah, no one's leaving.@k@vS20/11/440700195. None of you love your families too much, is that it? Nfu-fu-fu!``

TextJPN: 「「わっはっはっはっはっは…！！」」
一同も豪快に笑って景気付けをする。
TextENG: Everybody laughed uproariously, cheering things up.

TextJPN: 「各自、手元の資料を確認。監視カメラの所在と死角を叩き込んでください。@k@vS20/11/440700197.熊ちゃんは指揮車で待機。@k@vS20/11/440700198.非常時は私に代わって指揮をお願いしますよ」
TextENG: ``I want everyone to go over their materials. Memorize the locations and blind spots of all the security cameras.@k@vS20/11/440700197. Kuma-chan, you'll stand by in the command car.@k@vS20/11/440700198. If something happens, you'll switch with me and take over.

TextJPN: 「小宮山くんは突入Ａ班。敦くんは突入Ｂ班を指揮。@k@vS20/11/440700200.監視班は１から８まで所定の位置で監視を。@k@vS20/11/440700201.盆地くんはタイムテーブルを厳守。@k@vS20/11/440700202.署に怪しまれないようローテを管理して下さい」
TextENG: Komiyama-kun will head up Infiltration Team A. Atsushi-kun will lead team B.@k@vS20/11/440700200. Observation teams will set up at points one through eight.@k@vS20/11/440700201. Bonchi-kun, you're responsible for keeping a strict timetable.@k@vS20/11/440700202. Control your rotations so HQ doesn't get wise.

TextJPN: 「さて、待機中の班が一番大仕事ですよ？　課長に私の所在を聞かれたらとぼけて下さい」
TextENG: Now, the team on standby has the most important job, all right? If the section chief asks where I am, play dumb.``

TextJPN: 「「わっはっはっはっはっは！！」」
TextENG: ``````Wa-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!!``````

TextJPN: 「ゲストのエスコート役は私がやります。きっと会場へ連れて行きますので皆さん、気長に待っててください」
TextENG: ``I'll handle escorting our guest. You can be sure I'll bring 'em to the venue, so wait patiently, everyone.``

TextJPN: 「………落ちるっすかね。前原圭一は」
TextENG: ``...Wonder if he'll cave? Keiichi Maebara, that is.``

TextJPN: 「私の見たところじゃあ、明日明後日にはイケそうですよ。もうコロっとね。@k@vS20/11/440700206.んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``From what I've seen, we're set for tomorrow or the day after in that regard. It'll be easy.@k@vS20/11/440700206. Nfu-fu-fu-fu!``
